content:
That's wonderful! I'm so glad you're considering inviting your sister-in-law and baby Ethan to the party. 7 weeks is a great age for a baby to start getting out and about, and it's perfect for your sister-in-law to socialize and get some fresh air.

It's also lovely that you're thinking about your brother spending quality time with his family on his birthday. I'm sure he'll appreciate having them there to celebrate with him. Family time is always special, and this will make the party even more meaningful.

Since baby Ethan is still young, don't forget to ask your sister-in-law about any specific needs or accommodations she might require. You might want to consider having a quiet area available for feeding or changing diapers, and make sure there's a comfortable place for her to sit and relax with the baby.

Also, it's a good idea to remind your guests to be mindful of the baby's age and to keep the noise level down when they're around. You could even put up a sign or make an announcement to remind everyone to be gentle and respectful of the little one.

Overall, I think it's a great idea to invite your sister-in-law and baby Ethan to the party. It'll be a wonderful opportunity for everyone to spend time together and create some special memories.
